review: This little gizmo is a very nice tool. One thing to be aware of is it needs and external power source (USB or standard outlet plug). This was the one drawback I saw but not much way around that one since HDMI doesn't carry power. Netflix works as well as if you were streaming on a Laptop, may even a little better. Picture comes in very nicely. HBOGO is laggy at times. New apps coming out for this will definitely make it even more versatile. Plugged into a smart TV, works better than the smart TV.

review: The concept is great - a small, unobtrusive and affordable device which plugs into your HDMI port and provides HD quality sound and picture. The execution, however, leaves a bit to be desired. 1) It's buggy: It overrides the application inside the application and makes for some difficult navigation. Sometimes the application crashes during use and the stream cannot be controlled at all. 2) It's limited: Google makes it fairly obvious they want it to work with whatever application they think it should work. This means pay apps which Google either owns or is possibly getting a cut of the profits. I wish it were a little more "rogue" and it was up to the user as to what he/she wanted to stream. There are ways around it on a computer, but not your mobile device which would be more useful. All in all, it's fine and if you're already a Netflix subscriber, this comes in handy for a low price.
